citeinfo.title: Documenting Ecological Change in Time and Space: The San Joaquin Valley of California
citeinfo.othercit: in Mammalian Diversification: From Chromosomes to Phylogeography University of California, Berkeley (pp. 57-78, In press)

descript.abstract: Landscape change in the San Joaquin Valley of California -- pre-European settlement to 2000
descript.purpose: To prepare illustrations and data for publications related to changes in the San Joaquin Valley over time
descript.supplinf: Future edits will focus on enhancing the spatial boundaries of historical natural communities and the addition of additional time frames where possible.

idinfo.useconst: Permission is granted to use the data for any personal or academic purposes as long as notification of use is sent to sphillips@esrp.csustan.edu and derived products are clearly credited with Scott Phillips, CSU Stanislaus, ESRP. For commercial use, contact CSU Stanislaus, ESRP: info@esrp.csustan.edu.

procstep.procdesc: Edit the initial data using the Hall 1885 medium scale irrigation maps for the location of historical wetlands, Tulare Lake, Summit Lake, Buena Vista Lake, and Kern Lake.
Edit the initial data using the Piemeisel map along with reconnaissance soil surveys for the location of historical scrub lands unmapped in the initial data.
Develop a layer showing the extent of irrigated lands around 1912 using USDA data and add in the estimated extent of urban areas using reconnaissance soil survey base maps.
Develop a layer showing the extent of irrigated lands and some urban lands around 1945 using map in USBR report.
Develop a layer showing the extent of urban and irrigated farmland around 1977 using USGS LULC data
Derived a layer of irrigated agricultre and urban areas using ESRP land use and land cover data
Used Arc/Info overlay analysis (UNION) to combine layers and assign land use/land cover attributes for potential land cover and land cover during subsequent time frames.
Clipped data to boundary of the Great Central Valley region of California (UCSB, 1996) south of latitude 38 N

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Estimated natural communities and land use around 1885
Estimated natural communities and land use around 1912
Estimated natural communities and land use around 1945
Estimated natural communities and land use around 1977
Estimated natural communities and land use around 2000

overview.eaover: Land cover is represented at a very general community level (grasslands, saltbush scrub, water, wetlands, Valley oak woodland, riparian) and developed land use is in two broad categories (urban, irrigated agriculture).
overview.dsoverv: This data was designed to estimate landscape change over time in the San Joaquin Valley of California in a series of six time frames: pre-European settlement (approximately 1850), 1885, 1912, 1945, 1977, 2000. It was used to provide illustrations and tabular data in support of presentation and publications describing ecological change in the San Joaquin Valley of California.

distinfo.distliab: No warranty, expressed or implied is made by the ESRP regarding the utility of the data, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. These data are geographic illustrations and do not represent legal boundaries.
distinfo.techpreq: Software capable of reading ESRI Shapefiles. Specifications for file format are available from: http://www.esri.com/software/opengis/openpdf.html. Data may be distributed in Zip compressed format. Softwrae and source code for uncompressing files is available from http://www.info-zip.org/UnZip.html.
